original_definition: 'corner cabinet' means a refrigerating appliance with a direct sales function used to achieve geometrical continuity between two linear cabinets that are at an angle to each other and/or that form a curve. A corner cabinet does not have a recognisable longitudinal axis or length since it consists only of a filling shape (wedge or similar) and is not designed to function as a stand-alone refrigerated unit. The two ends of the corner cabinet are inclined at an angle between 30 ° and 90 °;
generated_definition: 'corner cabinet' means a piece of furniture designed to fit in a corner of a room, typically used for storing books, decorative items, or kitchen utensils.
